content:
Diagnosis
	1. Hypopharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma with bone metastases
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	12 Jan 2024 Diagnostic biopsy

	Radiotherapy
	15 Feb - 28 Feb 2024 Palliative radiotherapy to T7-T9 vertebrae

	Chemotherapy
	Pembrolizumab-Carboplatin-Paclitaxel commenced 20 Jan 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on imaging with improving symptoms

	Current issues
	Dysphagia, fatigue, bone pain

	Summary of consultation
	[redacted name] attended clinic today for review prior to cycle 4 of systemic therapy. Recent CT shows stable disease in primary tumor and bone metastases. His dysphagia has improved with previous palliative radiotherapy, now managing soft diet. Performance status remains 2. Back pain significantly improved following vertebral radiotherapy, now requiring only regular paracetamol. Latest bloods show stable renal function and acceptable haematological parameters for continued treatment.

	Further investigations
	CT neck/chest/abdomen/pelvis after cycle 6

	Medication prescribed
	Continue current supportive medications

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 weeks pre-cycle 5
Dietitian review arranged for next week

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function and electrolytes

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows stable disease in primary tumor and bone metastases

patient_facts.value: Back pain improved, requiring regular paracetamol
Stable renal function and acceptable haematological parameters

status_updates.value: Metastatic hypopharyngeal cancer showing stable disease on pembrolizumab-chemotherapy with symptomatic improvement following palliative radiotherapy
Stable disease on imaging with symptomatic improvement in dysphagia and back pain
Oncology review in 3 weeks pre-cycle 5, dietitian review next week
